subject: Re: [junit] execute code after assertion failure
msgSnippet: tearDown() is likely your first option. It may not be the best option, but that is what tearDown() is there for. So said  nkumar@hotwire.com  on  2003-02-04
messageBody:
tearDown() is likely your first option. It may not be the best option,
but that is what tearDown() is there for.

So said nkumar@... on 2003-02-04 --------------------

>Hi,
>
>What are the options to ensure that code is executed in a test
following an
>assertion failure? eg:
>
>assertEquals("example",expected,actual);
>//next line should always execute, even upon failure
>methodA();
>
>I can use tearDown() or a try/catch/finally block, but I was wondering
if
>there are any other options.
>
>Thanks,
>Nate
>
>
>
>
>
>
